page.title: 04Housing in South Bradford.
page.content: There is a great variety of housing in this part of Bradford ranging from 15 storey{high rise flats}to small {cottages}dating from the mid 17th century and from {semi detached} corporation houses to Bolling Hall now a museum but parts of which are an example of a Medieval{country house.} Many of the{back to back}mill workers homes were replaced by high rise flats and{maisonettes}but many of these concrete wonders of the 1960's and 70's are now showing structural weaknesses and the Newby Square complex is now being emptied prior to demolition and yet the buildings are less than 20 years old.The remaining back to back houses are being renovated and demolition seems to be a thing of the past.Many of the new homes are being built of stone or imitation stone.
